erc165 interface.description: ERC165 Standard Interface Detection Interface: Creates a standard method to publish and detect what interfaces a smart contract implements.

erc721 interface.description: ERC-721 Non-Fungible Token Standard, A standard interface for non-fungible tokens, also known as deeds.

erc1155 interface.description: EIP-1155: ERC-1155 Multi Token Standard, A standard interface for contracts that manage multiple token types. A single deployed contract may include any combination of fungible tokens, non-fungible tokens or other configurations (e.g. semi-fungible tokens).

erc1820.description: EIP-1820: Pseudo-introspection Registry Contract, This standard defines a universal registry smart contract where any address (contract or regular account) can register which interface it supports and which smart contract is responsible for its implementation.

erc173.description: Draft: EIP-173: Implementation example, Contract Ownership Standard, A standard interface for ownership of contracts.

erc173i.description: Draft: EIP-173 Interface for Contract Ownership Standard, A standard interface for ownership of contracts.

erc725i.description: Draft: EIP-725: Proxy Account. Standard functions for a unique identifiable proxy account to be used by humans, groups, organisations, objects and machines

erc1996i.description: Draft: EIP-1996: Holdable Token, An extension to the ERC-20 standard token that allows tokens to be put on hold. This guarantees a future transfer and makes the held tokens unavailable for transfer in the mean time. Holds are similar to escrows in that are firm and lead to final settlement.

erc2018i.description: Draft: EIP-2018: The clearing process turns the promise of a transfer into the actual movement of money from one account to another. A clearing agent decides if the transfer can be executed or not. The amount which should be transferred is not deducted from the balance of the payer, but neither is it available for another transfer and therefore ensures, that the execution of the transfer will be successful when it is executed.

erc2019i.description: Draft: EIP-2019: Fundable Token. An extension to the ERC-20 standard token that allows Token wallet owners to request a wallet to be funded, by calling the smart contract and attaching a fund instruction string.

erc2020i.description: Draft: EIP-2020: E-Money Standard Token. The E-Money Standard Token aims to enable the issuance of regulated electronic money on blockchain networks, and its practical usage in real financial applications.

erc2021i.description: Draft: EIP-2021: Payoutable Token: An extension to the ERC-20 standard token that allows Token wallet owners to request payout from their wallet, by calling the smart contract and attaching a payout instruction string.

solidityTips.body:
//Paul Razvan Berg tips (@PaulRBerg)
1️⃣ Use "type(uint256).max" instead of "uint256(-1)"
2️⃣ Surround code with {} to avoid "stack too deep"
3️⃣ Skip tuple vars with commas: "uint a, , ,"
4️⃣ Swap vars in one line: "(a,b)=(b,a)"
5️⃣ Use "assert" and get built-in formal verification with SMTChecker

-----------------------------------------------

// Daniel Luca tips (CleanUnicorn.eth)
1️⃣  You can format numbers in Solidity using underscores.
i.e.,
1_000 is a thousand
1_0_0_0 is a thousand
1_000e0_3 is a million

Python spec https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0515/

------------------------------
Contribute tips here: https://github.com/juanfranblanco/vscode-solidity/blob/master/snippets/solidity.json#L197-L201 
Escape the text using: https://www.freeformatter.com/json-escape.html
------------------------------
